metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4127 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 3.2.2 does not properly restrict SG_IO ioctl calls, which allows local users to bypass intended restrictions on disk read and write operations by sending a SCSI command to (1) a partition block device or (2) an LVM volume. Paolo Bonzini discovered a flaw in Linux's handling of the SG_IO ioctl command. A local user, or user in a VM could exploit this flaw to bypass restrictions and gain read/write access to all data on the affected block device.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4127` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2

notes.Note: apw> This seems to be seens as the right thing to do, but not so late in 3.2, expect to see something applied in the early merge window https://lkml.org/lkml/2011/12/22/366 The fixes have now hit mainline, there is a strong possibility that when these are applied to older releases we will get functionality regressions, will get them on precise as soon as possible.
